additional_descriptions.description:
File Name

Description

scRNAseq_metadata.csv

Contains sequencing statistics and sample-specific annotations for all 17 samples (PDOs and Tissue) generated in the original paper (Dolgos et al., 2025).

SR_sample_matrix.mtx

Sparse matrix file for each sample generated in the original paper (Dolgos et al., 2025), containing gene expression data (genes x cells) after genome alignment and cell demultiplexing. No quality control has been applied yet.

SR_sample_features.tsv

Tab-separated file containing gene identifiers (e.g., gene symbols or Ensembl IDs) for each sample generated in the original paper (Dolgos et al., 2025).

SR_sample_barcodes.tsv

Tab-separated file containing unique cell barcodes for each sample generated in the original paper (Dolgos et al., 2025).

Dolgos_early_passage_PDOs_matrix.mtx

Sparse matrix file for the combined early passage PDO samples of the original paper (Dolgos et al., 2025). This data has undergone quality control to exclude low-quality cells.

Dolgos_early_passage_PDOs_features.tsv

Tab-separated file containing gene identifiers for the combined early passage PDO samples of the original paper (Dolgos et al., 2025).

Dolgos_early_passage_PDOs_barcodes.tsv

Tab-separated file containing unique cell barcodes for the combined early passage PDO samples of the original paper (Dolgos et al., 2025).

Dolgos_early_passage_PDOs_metadata.csv

Contains per-cell metadata for the combined early passage PDO samples. Includes UMAP coordinates, size factors used for log normalization, clustering annotations, cell cycle phase annotations, culture conditions, and various signature scores.

Atlas_PCa_PDOs_matrix.mtx

Sparse matrix file for the combined PCa PDOs datasets (Dolgos_PDOs, Huang_PDOs, Song_PDOs, McCray_PDOs). This data has undergone quality control to exclude low-quality cells.

Atlas_PCa_PDOs_features.tsv

Tab-separated file containing gene identifiers for the combined PCa PDOs datasets (Dolgos_PDOs, Huang_PDOs, Song_PDOs, McCray_PDOs) .

Atlas_PCa_PDOs_barcodes.tsv

Tab-separated file containing unique cell barcodes for the combined PCa PDOs datasets (Dolgos_PDOs, Huang_PDOs, Song_PDOs, McCray_PDOs) .

Atlas_PCa_PDOs_metadata.csv

Contains per-cell metadata for the combined PCa PDOs datasets (Dolgos_PDOs, Huang_PDOs, Song_PDOs, McCray_PDOs). Includes UMAP coordinates, size factors used for log normalization, culture conditions and cell annotations.
Dolgos_Matched_Tissue_PDOs_matrix.mtx Sparse matrix file for the combined PCa tissues and PDOs datasets from the original paper (Dolgos et al., 2025). This data has undergone quality control to exclude low-quality cells.
Dolgos_Matched_Tissue_PDOs_features.tsv Tab-separated file containing gene identifiers for the combined PCa tissues and PDOs datasets from the original paper (Dolgos et al., 2025).
Dolgos_Matched_Tissue_PDOs_barcodes.tsv Tab-separated file containing unique cell barcodes for the combined PCa tissues and PDOs datasets from the original paper (Dolgos et al., 2025).
Dolgos_Matched_Tissue_PDOs_metadata.csv Contains per-cell metadata for the combined PCa PDOs datasets (Dolgos_PDOs, Huang_PDOs, Song_PDOs, McCray_PDOs). Includes UMAP coordinates, size factors used for log normalization, infer cnv score and cell annotations.

Dataset_Material_matrix.mtx

Sparse matrix of single-cell gene expression data for a given dataset (Dataset = Song, Huang, McCray, Henry, or Tabula_Sapiens) and material (Material = PDOs or Tissue). Data are provided either as released by the authors (after quality control) or after reproducing the QC described in the original publications (see Materials and Methods).

Dataset_Material_features.tsv

Tab-separated file listing gene identifiers for the PCa datasets (Dataset = Song, Huang, McCray, Henry, or Tabula_Sapiens) and material (Material = PDOs or Tissue), either as provided by the authors (after quality control) or after reproducing the QC described in the original publications (see Materials and Methods).

Dataset_Material_barcodes.tsv

Tab-separated file listing cell barcodes for the PCa datasets (Dataset = Song, Huang, McCray, Henry, or Tabula_Sapiens) and material (Material = PDOs or Tissue), either as provided by the authors (after quality control) or after reproducing the QC described in the original publications (see Materials and Methods).

Dataset_Material_metadata.csv

Contains per-cell metadata for the combined for the PCa datasets (Dataset = Song, Huang, McCray, Henry, or Tabula_Sapiens) and material (Material = PDOs or Tissue). Includes UMAP coordinates, size factors used for log normalization, cell annotations and original metadata (i.e cell type) when made accessible by the author.

metadata.description: Patient-derived organoids (PDOs) offer new opportunities to model various cancers. However, their application in prostate cancer (PCa) has been hampered by poor take-rates and overgrowth of benign cell types. Initial experiments with 136 samples highlighted the limitations of existing culture conditions, while 30 additional samples were subsequently used to explore the effects of niche factors, carbon source, and extracellular matrix (ECM) composition on organoid outcome. Single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) reveals that Matrigel-free PDOs exhibit cellular heterogeneity and preserve patient-specific PCa cell populations with active AR signaling, while enriching in intermediate club cell populations. In contrast, Matrigel fails to maintain primary PCa cells and produces in vitro basal-like benign transcriptomic profiles that are divergent from patient samples. Furthermore, we redefine cell type-signatures, identifying RNA- and protein-based biomarkers discriminating tumor versus all other cell types ex vivo, and show that expression of laminin-binding integrins is a hallmark of Matrigel-derived organoids. Finally, integrating previously-published datasets with our new data, we generate the first Prostate PDO single-cell atlas (PPScA). The PPScA captures a spectrum of cellular identities and malignancies, while revealing pathways universally altered in PDOs as compared to primary PCa tissues. Altogether, our study represents a significant advancement in the field, providing methodological improvements and novel cellular biology insights.

title.en: Investigating prostate cancer cellular heterogeneity and treatment response at single-cell level
Dissecting prostate cancer cellular heterogeneity and treatment response at single-cell level
An organoid-based co-clinical pilot trial in metastatic prostate cancer

references.reference: ECM-free patient-derived organoids preserve diverse prostate cancer lineages and uncover in vitro-enriched cell types Robin Dolgos, Romuald Parmentier, Jing Wang, Raphaelle Servant, Arnoud J Templeton, Tobias Zellweger, Alastair D Lamb, Kirsten D Mertz, Svetozar Subotic, Tatjana Vlajnic, Helge Seifert, Ashkan Mortezavi, Cyrill A Rentsch, Lukas Bubendorf, Clementine Le Magnen bioRxiv 2024.10.16.618617; doi: https://doi.org/10.1101/2024.10.16.618617

metadata.title: Single-cell analysis uncovers preserved prostate cancer lineages and universally altered pathways in Matrigel-free patient-derived organoids
